org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure

Class HostsFileBasedInfrastructureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure.InfrastructureManager
      • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure.HostsFileBasedInfrastructureManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, NodeSourcePlugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoUpdateInfrastructure, CLIInfrastructure, SSHInfrastructure, SSHInfrastructureV2

    public abstract class HostsFileBasedInfrastructureManager
extends InfrastructureManager
    Abstract infrastructure Manager implementation based on hosts list file.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • initializePersistedInfraVariables

        protected void initializePersistedInfraVariables()
        Description copied from class: InfrastructureManager
        This method should initialize a value in the runtime variables map for all the runtime variables that will be used in the class. It is called at initialization time of the infrastructure, just before the InfrastructureManager.configure(Object...) method. This method runs with the write lock acquired.
        Specified by:
        initializePersistedInfraVariables in class InfrastructureManager

      • configure

        protected void configure(Object... parameters)
        Configures the infrastructure. parameters[0] = hosts list file content parameters[1] = timeout of the node deployment parameters[2] = max deployment failure parameters[3] = wait time between failures
        Specified by:
        configure in class InfrastructureManager
        Parameters:
        parameters - of the infrastructure manager

      • readHosts

        protected void readHosts(File f)
                  throws IOException
        Internal host file parser

        File format: one host per line, optionally followed by a space and an integer describing the maximum number of runtimes (1 if not specified). Example: 

         example.com
 example.org 5
 example.net 3
        Parameters:
        f - the file from which hosts names are to be extracted
        Throws:
        IOException - parsing failed

      • notifyDeployingNodeLost

        protected void notifyDeployingNodeLost(String pnURL)
        This method is called by Infrastructure Manager in case of a deploying node removal. We take advantage of it to specify to the remote process control loop of the removal. This one will then exit.
        Overrides:
        notifyDeployingNodeLost in class InfrastructureManager
        Parameters:
        pnURL - the deploying node's URL for which one the timeout occurred.

      • startNodeImpl

        protected abstract void startNodeImpl(HostTracker hostTracker,
                                      int nbNodes,
                                      List<String> depNodeURLs)
                               throws RMException
        Launch the node on the host passed as parameter
        Parameters:
        hostTracker - The host on which one the node will be started
        nbNodes - number of nodes to deploy
        depNodeURLs - list of deploying or lost nodes urls created
        Throws:
        RMException - If the node hasn't been started. Very important to take care of that in implementations to keep the infrastructure in a coherent state.
